summary: Crowley, a demon, went into a church to save Aziraphale. Walking on consecrated ground is dangerous for him, but he went into a...
body: Crowley, a demon, went into a church to save Aziraphale. Walking on consecrated ground is dangerous for him, but he went into a church long enough to do a full monologue at the Nazi spies and save an angel. Did he ever really need to tell Aziraphale he loves him when he did that?

reblog.comment: Crowley, a demon, went into a church to save Aziraphale. Walking on consecrated ground is dangerous for him, but he went into a church long enough to do a full monologue at the Nazi spies and save an angel. Did he ever really need to tell Aziraphale he loves him when he did that?

summary: Ok but last post before I jump into Good Omens ep. 4 but Aziraphale’s fake human name is Mr. Fell, literally Fell, it’s right...
body:
Ok but last post before I jump into Good Omens ep. 4 but Aziraphale’s fake human name is Mr. Fell, literally Fell, it’s right there in his name.

Past tense, Aziraphale fell guys, already, and no one has told him because the sides are all screwed up. The situation with the angels and demons being “sides” is practically, and maybe literally, a test to see who chooses to be good and who is bad for real instead of just because they think it’s who they are.

This has Pratchett morality all over it. He was so against people whose goodness was only for appearances, or who believed themselves good without effort, or who just paid lip service. “Mind how you go” was basically his view on morality in a nutshell, and it was so telling that they put that exact phrase, haltingly, into Aziraphale’s mouth but Aziraphale doesn’t mind how he goes when he goes to Paris, he doesn’t take into account at all his surroundings or how to actually help people around him and not be buried in his own petty and selfish concerns. 

Crowley is, weirdly, almost like Vimes in how little he sees himself as a good person vs. how much good he actually does. Because the labels don’t matter to Pratchett, what matters is your actions, taking care of people around you and looking out for them. Crowley is explicitly trying to save the world and has to drag Aziraphale along, Crowley goes into a situation of personal suffering to help Aziraphale in the church, he’s literally coaching Aziraphale on goodness because through their friendship, Aziraphale is learning to be a more mindful person of others and is learning how to take care of those around him like Crowley and look after people other than himself. He’s not actively evil, our Az, but he is a shade of gray of not really paying attention to others and the one time he really put himself out there was with the flaming sword which was a truly good thing he did, despite fearing repercussions and it, in a way, actually scared him off from taking bold action up until the Apocalypse, from the look of it. 

I mean, I know I’m being tough on Az here, but the morality so far is really fascinating in how it’s basically the Biblical parable of Jesus pointing out how the man who prays loudly and uses prayer to humble-brag is not actually good and the tax collector (seen as the ultimate evil person at that time)  who prays quietly and doesn’t call attention to their “goodness” actually is good. 

Though I don’t want to give Crowley too much credit here so I’ll add this - it’s not that either of them is all good or bad. Interestingly, it seems Aziraphale’s angelic nature and his lip service to goodness actually do inspire Crowley. Their interactions make both of them better people through accountability to others for their actions, another big Pratchettian aspct of morality. I’m not saying Good Omens is out and out a morality tale, as such, but what’s interesting is watching Crowley and Aziraphale believe themselves to be at the end of the journey of morality, being absolute representations of good and evil, when really what we witness throughout is their journey towards becoming better people.

summary: the thing that makes Aziraphale and Crowley so appealing as characters and entertaining to watch together is that despite being...
body: the thing that makes Aziraphale and Crowley so appealing as characters and entertaining to watch together is that despite being completely different, dissimilar people, they are so enamored of each other and they like one another so particularly much that none of it matters to either of them so long as the other is happy and they’re able to be together

reblog.comment: the thing that makes Aziraphale and Crowley so appealing as characters and entertaining to watch together is that despite being completely different, dissimilar people, they are so enamored of each other and they like one another so particularly much that none of it matters to either of them so long as the other is happy and they’re able to be together

tags: enemies to friends to lovers slowburn fanfic in video form
summary:
"I have lots of other people to fraternise with, Angel."
"Of course you do."
"I don't need you."
"Well, and the feeling is...
body:
“I have lots of other people to fraternise with, Angel.”

“Of course you do.”

“I don’t need you.”

“Well, and the feeling is mutual. Obviously.”

“*mockingly mimics* Obviously”

body:
Yknow what mother fuckers

Imma do it. Im gonna write a long ass masterpost detailing all the subtext, implications and canonical evidence of crowley and aziraphale being in love. Because to me, there is so much substance to it that I can actually personally consider it canon. And i need to share this with all the new fans who are just getting into this. Finally my encyclopedic knowledge of good omens is going to come in handy

Finally my encyclopedic knowledge of good omens is going to come in handy

Imma do it. Im gonna write a long ass masterpost detailing all the subtext, implications and canonical evidence of crowley and aziraphale being in love. Because to me, there is so much substance to it that I can actually personally consider it canon. And i need to share this with all the new fans who are just getting into this. Finally my encyclopedic knowledge of good omens is going to come in handy

summary: Remember that time in Rome when Aziraphale invited Crowley to a gay bar to eat oysters, a known aphrodisiac and Crowley thought...
body:
Remember that time in Rome when Aziraphale invited Crowley to a gay bar to eat oysters, a known aphrodisiac and Crowley thought he was getting laid?

Yeah.

Me too.

blog.description: DON'T FUCKING TAG MY POSTS AS #q slur BECAUSE I WILL BLOCK YOU // Main ♢ ghost-of-an-italian-partisan // Alex they/them // I had some discourse here earlier but no more of that because I'm #Tired // Crowley is the little spoon you CAN'T change my mind // Pretty positive Aziraphale banged Oscar Wilde at some point // Adam my sweet child, please don't end the world I have finals to do // It doesn't matter how much I try to stop, I'll always read Beelzebub's name sang by Freddie Mercury // Give Crowley a hug 2k19 // I'm a minor so keep that in mind please

summary: "crowley is the little spoon you can't change my mind" why WOULD i? aziraphale is big n soft n cuddly it just makes the most...
question: "crowley is the little spoon you can't change my mind" why WOULD i? aziraphale is big n soft n cuddly it just makes the most Sense
answer:
yeah!!! he’s also very very wARM and Crowley’s snake instincts/cold blood make him go nuts for it

let’s face it: Crowley’s been through some shit, he needs some physical comfort and Aziraphale being his big spoon is kinda like having an old grumpy backpack that loves him

writing blog

tags: i couldve just stopped at what if we slowly fell in love even tho were supposed to be on opposite sides of a cosmic war but i went with
this longass post instead. bc its all ive been thinking abt
summary: what if 😳over the course of 6000 years stationed on earth together 🌍we slowly fall in love even though we’re supposed to be on...
body:
what if 😳over the course of 6000 years stationed on earth together 🌍we slowly fall in love even though we’re supposed to be on opposite sides of a cosmic war 👨‍❤️‍💋‍👨and we work together to try to stop the apocalypse bc we both know that what heaven AND hell is doing is wrong, but the apocalypse happens anyway because we lost track of the antichrist, and because im afraid of whats going to happen i beg you to run away with me, not for the first time, but its definitely the first time youve noticed, and then i run into a burning building trying to find u and get shitfaced drunk by myself instead of trying to leave the doomed earth bc i think ur gone 🔥🍷and then when everything is over, i ask u to come home to my apartment with me and u say that ur “side” wouldnt like that, and because i notice that ur not actually saying u dont want to, i tell u softly that we arent on anyone else’s sides, we’re on OUR side, and its not the first time ive told u that but its the first time uve really believed me, and we go home together, and then we swap bodies in anticipation of heaven and hell coming to kill us and because we know each other so well we manage to fool them into believing we’re each other and successfully avoid death, and then we dine at the ritz together while romantic music swells 😳😳😳

(and we’re an angel and a demon)
